thread.title: This Intense, Total-Body Tabata Workout Will Torch Fat
thread.title_full: This Intense, Total-Body Tabata Workout Will Torch Fat

author: Barry K
title: This Intense, Total-Body Tabata Workout Will Torch Fat

organizations.name: total-body tabata workout will torch fat shift

text:
This Intense, Total-Body Tabata Workout Will Torch Fat Shift your metabolism into overdrive with this mix of plyometric and resistance moves Your Privacy Rights Canadian Customers 
This third workout in our Tabata Makes You Hotta series is a total-body scorcher from Hannah Eden, owner of Pumpfit in Fort Lauderdale, Fla. The mix of explosive exercises and resistance training moves will give you tremendous cardiovascular conditioning and a killer muscle burn. 
During round 1, you'll get the heart pumping and core activated by alternating between broad jumps and medicine ball mountain climbers. The kettlebell high pull and overhead press in round 2 will smash your delts. You'll get an insane cardio pump from surfer burpees and wall sprawls in round 3. Finally, your legs and lungs will be burning like hell from switching between the dumbbell goblet squat and the band jump squat in round 4. Advertisement 
If you are a fan of tabatas, don't forget to check out Eden's other workouts in the series: Tabata Makes You Hotta 1 and Tabata Makes You Hotta 2 . 
Directions: Perform the exercises listed below for 20 seconds each, resting for 10 seconds after each move. 
1a. Broad jump 
1b. Medicine ball mountain climber 
That's 1 round. Perform 4 rounds. Rest 1 minute before moving to the next pair. Then perform the next two exercises listed below for 20 seconds each, resting for 10 seconds after each move. 
2a. Kettlebell high pull 
2b. Kettlebell overhead press 
That's 1 round. Perform 4 rounds. Rest 1 minute before moving to the next pair. Then perform the next two exercises listed below for 20 seconds each, resting for 10 seconds after each move. 
3a. Wall sprawl 
3b. Surfer burpee 
That's 1 round. Perform 4 rounds. Rest 1 minute before moving to the next pair. Then perform the next two exercises listed below for 20 seconds each, resting for 10 seconds after each move. 
4a. Band goblet squat
